meanings.definition: A member of a municipal legislative body, especially in England.
meanings.sent1: The alderman proposed a new law to help keep the town clean.
meanings.sent2: The alderman attended the council meeting to discuss important issues.
meanings.sent3: The alderman accidentally brought his pet parrot to the town hall meeting, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The alderman's influence in the council was like a guiding light in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The image of the alderman in his top hat and tails became a symbol of local leadership.

meanings.definition: A member of a city council or town council, often representing a specific district or ward.
meanings.sent1: The alderman from the east side of town worked hard to improve the local parks.
meanings.sent2: Every neighborhood had its own alderman who listened to the concerns of the residents.
meanings.sent3: The alderman organized a silly hat contest to bring the community together.
meanings.sent4: The alderman's voice echoed through the council chambers, commanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The alderman's dedication to his ward was unwavering, like a sturdy oak tree in a storm.
